intro: Thlaspiceras triangulare, commonly known as the triangular thlaspiceras, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive triangular-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate forest understories. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a branching stem that supports its delicate foliage. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
